section.heading: Recordkeeping and identification of trust property.

para.text: A trustee shall keep adequate records of the administration of the trust.
A trustee shall keep trust property separate from the trustee’s own property.

Except as otherwise provided in subsection (d) of this section, a trustee shall cause the trust property to be designated so that the interest of the trust, to the extent feasible, appears in records maintained by a party other than a trustee or beneficiary.
If the trustee maintains records clearly indicating the respective interests, a trustee may invest as a whole the property of 2 or more separate trusts.

annoGroup.heading: Editor's Notes
annoGroup.annotation: Uniform Law: This section is based upon § 810 of the Uniform Trust Code.
